author: Marcus Aurelius
content: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: Do every act of your life as though it were your last.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: Begin each day by telling yourself: Today I shall be meeting with interference, ingratitude, insolence, disloyalty, ill-will... all these things will happen to me today. But I have not come to dwell on these things, but to meet them, and to treat them justly.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.

author: Epictetus
content: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.

author: Epictetus
content: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Epictetus
content: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

author: Epictetus
content: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the views which they take of them.

author: Epictetus
content: No man is free who is not master of himself.

author: Epictetus
content: Only the educated are free.

author: Epictetus
content: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.

author: Epictetus
content: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

author: Epictetus
content: We should always be asking ourselves: "Is this something that is, or is not, in my control?"

author: Epictetus
content: To accuse others for one's own misfortunes is a sign of want of education. To accuse oneself shows that one's education has begun.

author: Epictetus
content: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.

author: Epictetus
content: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

author: Epictetus
content: Don't demand that things happen as you wish, but wish that they happen as they do, and you will go on well.

author: Epictetus
content: Circumstances do not make the man, they only reveal him to himself.

author: Epictetus
content: It's not what you give up, but what you become.

author: Epictetus
content: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

author: Epictetus
content: Nature gave men one tongue but two ears, that we may hear from others twice as much as we speak.

author: Seneca
content: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

author: Seneca
content: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

author: Seneca
content: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.

author: Seneca
content: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.

author: Seneca
content: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.

author: Seneca
content: He is most powerful who has power over himself.

author: Seneca
content: Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.

author: Seneca
content: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.

author: Seneca
content: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.

author: Seneca
content: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.

author: Seneca
content: While we teach, we learn.

author: Seneca
content: It is quality rather than quantity that matters.

author: Seneca
content: Life, if well lived, is long enough.

author: Seneca
content: No man was ever wise by chance.

author: Seneca
content: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.

author: Seneca
content: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.

author: Seneca
content: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.

author: Seneca
content: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.

content: The unexamined life is not worth living.

author: Socrates
content: To find yourself, think for yourself.

author: Socrates
content: Let him that would move the world first move himself.

author: Socrates
content: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.

author: Socrates
content: Strong minds discuss ideas, average minds discuss events, weak minds discuss people.

content: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.

content: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

author: Plato
content: Courage is knowing what not to fear.

author: Plato
content: The beginning is the most important part of the work.

author: Plato
content: I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing.

author: Plato
content: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.

content: Well begun is half done.

content: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.

content: Silence is a source of great strength.

author: Peter Drucker
content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

author: Wayne Gretzky
content: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.

author: Lao Tzu
content: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

author: Henry Kissinger
content: A diamond is a chunk of coal that did well under pressure.

author: Joseph Chilton Pearce
content: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.

author: Yoda
content: Do or do not. There is no try.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
content: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.

author: William James
content: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

author: Sam Levenson
content: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
content: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.

author: African proverb
content: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
